attributes.action: Provide financial support to self employed private hire taxi drivers amid crisis
attributes.additional_details: To support the public service we offer to key workers, who like us are still risking their lives daily to go to work and help in critical roles to ensure the country can continue to function, we urge you to avoid families supported by self employed taxi drivers from falling into poverty and financial ruin. It would appear that amongst the guidelines set these key workers are forgotten and livelihoods our at risk, please consider this in your bill and what support you can provide
attributes.background: We would urge the government to consider not only small businesses that are self employed but also self employed private hire taxi drivers and the financial impact the current crisis is having on families supported by these workers. These are also key workers transporting NHS and other key workers

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/
UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.

Find out more and watch the Committee put questions suggested by petitioners to Government Ministers and the Deputy Chief Medical Officer: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/news/145767/committee-question-deputy-chief-medical-officer-and-ministers-on-coronavirus-response/

Read letters asking further questions of Government Ministers: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/publications/3/correspondence/
